website_summaries.verdict: Great range and boost, but you do have to mount an external antenna to get the real benefit of this. Unit is surprisingly affordable, too.
pros: Great power, great range and omnidirectional antenna means you don't have to know where cell towers are to get good reception
cons: Must mount antenna on roof for unit to be noticeably effective

customer_reviews.title: This used to work excellent going from zero to one bars to two or ...
customer_reviews.text: This used to work excellent going from zero to one bars to two or three bars until I got an iPhone . I called technical support they even sent me a directional antenna and a larger coax cable to improve signal with the iPhone but did not help. After installation I called them back they told me the iPhone puts out a different signal which this piece of equipment would not pick up so now does not work with the iPhone to bring a better signal and keep this in mind Before purchasing if you have an iPhone or plan to get one may want to check with other phone manufactures also through support
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Cell phone coverage with a Metal roof
customer_reviews.text: I use this Booster for my cell phones as our house has a metal roof-I also installed the antenna outside for the highest gain possible.This complete setup is the only reason I can use my cell in my house-If you need to boost your signal both in and out buy the complete setup. (Important) When installing your outside antenna be sure and have it ABOVE your roof-if not the roof will interfere with receiving and transmitting-also if using a metal pole be sure to (ground) it-if possible to your house ground.Thought I should include this in my review.
customer_reviews.author: Muthergun

customer_reviews.title: Better Without It
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my cell phone signal was weak. I found we could use our phone in one location in the house. Reading the reviews on this, I figured I was home free since it brags about picking up just such a weak signal and broadcasting it throughout several hundred square feet. I never found this unit to work well. If it is because I didn't "tweak" the installation just right, then count me out. I tried everything, every window position, temporarily outside, in the exact same location we could use our cell phones, etc. In addition, the requirement that the base be a certain distance from the antenna was difficult to resolve.
customer_reviews.author: CautiousBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service, but design flaw in the unit
customer_reviews.text: Although the customer support was most helpful, there is a design flaw in the unit itself. In an area of periodic signal loss, (such as living in the mountains) the unit is not designed to reset when the signal is regained. The result is that phone service may be out for hours or days before the consumer notices the red flashing light, and power cycles the booster. With careful adjustment to the antenna direction, I have been able to get the system to be perhaps 95 percent operational... still it's that five percent that could be an emergency call missed, that is a problem.
customer_reviews.author: F. J. Lozen

customer_reviews.title: Works so good that I got another one for my new home
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one - the first I left for the new owners of my prior home. This time set up is a little more tricky as the home is smaller with less distance between the antennae and the inside unit. Also, we have 3 cell-antennas - each 15 miles a way, which outside yields 1 bar, inside without the booster...less because of our metal roof. Still 2-3 bars inside is great!
customer_reviews.author: C.  Dix

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This did not help at all. We raised the antenna twice and didnt help. We registered it with our carrier as instructed. Everytime we go to use the phone or turn our computers on, the signal turns red, but its green while not being used... when we first used it few days, it helped and we had 3 bars vs 1 bar. Now it does no justice at all. drops calls just like before. this is a total waste of flippin money!!! I hate it!!!. unfortunately its too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: C E

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly useful!
customer_reviews.text: Makes service inside a house where it otherwise wouldn't be! It does what we need it to, but it has to be unplugged and plugged back in a few times a day to ensure consistent service. It may just be the area, but it'll flash red (and be not working) those few times a day, especially when there's a storm. The main thing is that it works most of the time and lets us know when it isn't. As another note: It would have been fairly easy to set up, even without my tech guy doing it for me. So that was awesome, too.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Works but we tweaked it
customer_reviews.text: The booster and original antenna didn't work as well as adding Zboost directional antenna. We upgraded the capable to 30 ft RG6 cable from wilson. Then we placed the antenna in the attic and the booster in the basement. We are having success in making calls and receiving with 99% success rates. Before we would drop calls and get static, finally end up outside to make calls...so we are very happy this is working for us. It has been freezing cold out, this helped us significantly. I would of given it 5 stars...but we tweaked it with a better cable and antenna, so the original product could be improved.
customer_reviews.author: Bigbluefrog

customer_reviews.title: Crap... crap... crap.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried everything to make this work properly. Different mounting places, different heavy duty cable (the cable provided can't get any cheaper). It did once in a while, I guess whenever the wind was blowing in the right direction. It got worse and worse and in the end the cable do-hickey broke from the board. When I opened it up to try to fix it, surgery revealed a very cheap board with no real soldering points. For about a year it was my exercise machine - get up and unplug it/ plug it back in so I can complete a call, guess I'll have to buy a treadmill. NOT recommended, should be selling for 29.99 on late night TV.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You can hear me now...
customer_reviews.text: This was a breeze to set up and it worked great when complete. The instructions were simple, the parts minimal, and the results were above expectations. This model brought us from an original zero or one bar of available service up to a now very satisfactory three and four bars of service. We now get a usable signal in all rooms of our modest single story 1000 sf home, and the sturdy construction of the unit gives us every reason to believe it will continue to do so for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Chris T Woods

customer_reviews.title: Great repeater
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and installed it for a friend that was continually having dropped calls when in certain rooms of her house. Her phone would show 3G with the data bars at one bar. After installation same 3G but the data bars are at five (I think that is the max). I also have one of these installed at my ranch inside a metal building. My phone would ring but you could not answer now the bars are at max and I can even Skype inside the motorhome inside the shop. (I did use a directional antenna for the ranch and not the supplied omi-driectional antenna)
customer_reviews.author: SeaDog

customer_reviews.title: It is a repeater, not magic.
customer_reviews.text: It is a repeater, not magic. If there is no signal to get, well there is no signal to repeat. I use it on the first floor of a 3-story concrete office building which is surrounded by other office buildings. Before it was impossible to stream my iHeart music. Now streaming music is tolerable. As far as the cell phone, it provides me with a strong enough signal to carry on a conversation without a dropped call. Note, it only boost the signal in my office as the walls are concrete. Lastly, I had to mount the antenna outside for the repeater to work. The higher the better. - Yes, I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Not as much range as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.text: the coverage area I believe is based on open area and does not take into consideration walls. I can barely get a boost if I am 2 rooms over, but in the same room it is maxed out. The room it is set up in is a conference room, roughly 20x20 in size. No issue with boost there, but go down the hall, and you wouldn't even know the product was even in the building.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm G

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me in Hawaii
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me in Hawaii. My T-Mobile reception was mediocre on the southern part of the Big Island. I installed this unit in the home and placed the antenna on a 20 foot pole mounted on top of my house. I now have much better service for transmission and reception inside my house. If you live in a rural area get one, it works! I live in a mountainous area and the closest cell tower at my location is 5 miles away and after installing this booster my cell service got better.
customer_reviews.author: ob1

customer_reviews.title: Dramatically improves signal if you have AT&T or T-Mobile
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but range is limited. Improved signal strength from 0 to 1 bar to 3 to 4 bars. Can get 4 to 5 bars if I stand within 6 feet of it. I have AT&T and the signal strength where I live is terrible. This unit at least allows me to make calls from my house whereas before I could not make calls at all or if by chance it my phone did connect it would drop completely. I believe there is a different outdoor antennae you can buy to further increase signal strength or just buy a new phone with a different carrier. I went to Sprint and now get 5 bars anywhere in the house.
customer_reviews.author: JLB_TX

customer_reviews.title: product works but...
customer_reviews.text: product works as described, but there was a problem with connecting cable (supplied) with booster.. The cable and booster had the same female fitting and could not be put together. called zboost and customer service after some questions said part would be sent UPS. It arrived timely but was a female fitting, and you cannot connect females with females. purchased male connecting fitting from local hardware store and went from 1 bar on cell phone to 3 or 4 bars. zboost should certainly include fitting and have support personnel who know what it looks like.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Works great even were i didnt get 1 bar!
customer_reviews.text: I live way out in the country were I didn't get a signal at all.Not 1 bar now I'm getting up to 3-4bars of 4g and able to post this review from turning my movlie hotspot on.And able to run my laptop off the connection pretty awesome!My friends thought I was ignoring them not getting any signal at all were I live but now I can make clear calls and have decent internet speed.Even tho I just got it for making calls on my phone I live on 160 acres of wooded property so don't think this will not help you.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Expensive garbage. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the YX545 as well as the 039 antenna and am now throwing in the towel. The best I can say is that I get four bars when the phone is within a few feet of the booster. Even then it usually drops the calls. Very disappointing in view of the money I've spent and time wasted. I've had series of contacts with Wi-Ex support, none of which were in any way helpful. They suggested several problems including interference from metal near the booster or the antenna. So I moved the booster and mounted the antenna on a 10 foot PVC mast. No improvement. Bottom line: interesting website, crummy product, pathetic tech support.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pole buildings.
customer_reviews.text: I use the Cell phone booster in an all metal building. Without it, I have to hold my cell phone near a window or go outside. With the booster, I get 5 bars, anywhere inside my 70 foot by 42 foot building. Easy to install, and works good.
customer_reviews.author: Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Terribly disappointed in this product and company!
customer_reviews.text: This lasted about one month. I ordered another before this one stopped working for the other side of the building and it stopped working in a week. I contacted the company via email and they have never gotten back to me other than to confirm they received my email and would get back to me. That was weeks ago. Totally frustrated with the product and the customer service. When it did work, it actually did help my cell signal, but I don't want to have to replace it every few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.  Does in a year!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we have purchased in the last two years. Both only lasted a year and the power cord either quits working or the entire unit stops working. Leading up to ultimate failure the unit requires a restart once a week before dying completely. Switching to a completely different brand and never going back. We live in a rural area with one bar and it only boosted to three bars at best. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Moore

customer_reviews.title: Best product I have bought in years!! It works like they say it does!
customer_reviews.text: Just installed in 4000 square foot metal roof home that had no cell phone reception in the house.Put the external antenna on a 30 ft pole outside and now we 4 bars any where in the house!!! Great product for under $200! The only bad thing I can say is you have to run wire from antenna into the house to the booster. I will do that any day to get 4 Bars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with MetroPCS
customer_reviews.text: I have MetroPCS, which uses the frequency (1900 MHz PCS) advertised for this unit. I have a powerful directional roof antenna (next to which I am able to get good reception on my phone) which I connected (by RC-6 cable) to this unit in the house (where my reception is poor). Nothing happened. I used the included antenna and the included cable, running that antenna/cable into the attic (as high as it would reach). Nothing happened again. IMO this is an expensive paperweight. I returned it. Amazon was very good with the return process.
customer_reviews.author: Snavvy

customer_reviews.title: This product didn't do the job.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a "black hole" where the cell-phone signal is lower than usual. The metal mesh that supports the plaster in walls and ceilings in my older home lowers the signal to unreliable levels in some parts of the house. I had hoped this "Wireless Extender" would boost the signal enough to give me reliable service. It didn't. No matter where I put the receiving antenna or the transmitter, the signal seemed as poor as it did before. I'm thankful that the firm that sold it to me took it back and refunded my money without question.
customer_reviews.author: Vinyl Bill

customer_reviews.title: Spotty signal
customer_reviews.text: My home has a metal roof and is partially underground. I had very little to no signal inside my apartment. We installed the antenna and now I have a signal inside. Still have a few spots where the signal goes in and out and it goes out every time it rains. Still have to go outside to get a signal to talk on the phone but I do receive text messages for the most part now. I have Cricket Wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Barkman

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes yes and sometimes no
customer_reviews.text: This is a hit and miss. I had two that I was very happy with in Texas. I bought one for Florida and it did nothing. If you have two bars and want five this will do the trick. If you have one and want more forget it. It needs a signal to boost. Walk around the outside of your house with your cell phone. If you can find a spot with a few bars than this unit is for you. If you cant, save yourself the hastle.
customer_reviews.author: stephen newmarkTop Contributor: Racquetball

customer_reviews.title: or with the recommended antenna, neither Amazon nor the manufacturer would allow ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this amplifier, along with a YX026-CEL directional antenna to improve our home cellular reception. Customer support was knowledgeable and helpful, but despite numerous suggestions, we were never able to get it working. Using the provided antenna, we received a bar's worth of improvement. By the time we concluded it wasn't going to work, alone, or with the recommended antenna, neither Amazon nor the manufacturer would allow us to return the items for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Kampe

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, but not for the range described
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and it works mostly as described. We put the antenna outside where we got 4 bars of service and now we get 4 bars of service in the basement where we normally had no service. The reason I am rating this 4 stars is because the range of service extension is much smaller than described. I only see increased service in the 1 room (500 Square feet) where the transmitter is located and not 2,500 square feet as described. I think it must be something in our walls blocking the signal. We are currently playing around with the transmitters location trying to get it to extend through the whole basement rather than just the 1 room.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well for us
customer_reviews.text: Update April 2014: Gave it to my school teacher son. He has signal issues at his house as well and it didn't work well for him either. Again, I recommend a more expensive roof mounted unit. We constantly had to take our phone to the booster to "touch it to the antenna" to get my phone to accept the boosted signal. If I had it to do all over again, I would have purchased a different, more expensive roof mounted system. It's definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dave J

customer_reviews.title: Z-Boost Pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this with some hesitation for my sister in law that lives in the cornfields of Maryland. Installed it as advised and instructions were very easy. Outside she gets 2-3 bars of At&T 3G, but inside nadda-zip, nuttin, only in one corner of the house against the wall....... once installed with best signal outside, turned it on and inside the whole house was 4 bars as well as internet usb usage at 3-4 bars.... OUTSTANDING!!! very happy with this purchase. and if you have a signal outside, it will boost it inside as same signal.... getting one for my home next... Good job... Steve M, PA
customer_reviews.author: Steven Maggioncalda

customer_reviews.title: Thank You Amazon
customer_reviews.text: When I got this product, it didn't have the power cord as described, but the staff at Amazon gave me a discount on the item I already received. It doesn't work really great, but I blame that on where we live. LITERALLY out in the middle of nowhere in Central California. I'm going to get a longer coax cable and run the antennae outside to see if I can get a better signal. Anyway, you guys are great, the product was great and sent to us quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Atwell

customer_reviews.title: they have excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: We got help from customer service, they have excellent customer service. Our place is low and surrounded by trees, but now we are able to make a call. The service is spotty for voice, not the fault of the zBoost, but strong enough for data so we can also get internet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My zBoost YX545 SOHO Dual-Band Signal Booster Works.
customer_reviews.text: The zBooster works as a signal booster I have found that it gives me two extra bars in the house. I placed the antenna in my attic in the area of my strongest phone signal and ran it down through a closet corner and under the floor then over to where I wanted to place it in the house. I used an RG6 50 foot cable which I purchased separate. I find that it is not great about extending the signal through walls the more you stay in an open space the better the signal. It has helped me enough that I will keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Mc Allister

customer_reviews.title: Cell Phone Signal Booster
customer_reviews.text: If you live in a rural area with only slight to intermittent Cell Phone signal this product will be of interest. For home application this unit is very capable. It is very easy to install and setup. Out of the box, ready to use only takes five (5) to ten (10) minutes to be up and running with a signal boost of three (3} to four (4) bars. I can now use my Cell Phone anywhere in my residence. These same units sell for $300.00 in retail stores, which is rediculous, so the Amazon price fairly resonable. You will not be disappointed in this unit, for home use, if you are having problems with your Cell Phone signal.
customer_reviews.author: LSKilbreath

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I read ALL the reviews about this product, made sure we purchased the upgraded antenna (Wireless Extenders Zboost YX039) and the RG6 coax cable, kept away from metal and other cables and it works AMAZING. We had NO bars inside, sometimes maybe 1, now we have 4 and 5. It takes a bit of patience trying different locations but do it, so very worth it. I racked up over 10,000 cell rollover minutes, ALL minutes going to waste and ALL while haveing to use long distance calling family and friends on a land line! No more of that, have it, love it, recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jewelgirl

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I got this product and put it in my home and it worked good for about 4 months. Then it quit working and had a hard time with zBoost with getting it replaced. They finely replaced it with a WeBoost and it worked for over 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Emory F Johnson

customer_reviews.title: You Can Hear Me Now
customer_reviews.text: I've sold three of these recently to customers and haven't heard of a single complaint. They all speak highly of how easy it is to install and get things up and running. A recommendation I've been giving to customers is on the location of your external antenna. The best way to test your signal strength is by placing your phone where you are going to mount the antenna. If you can't get a steady signal with your phone then you aren't going to get a steady signal with the booster. You don't have to have five bars but as long as the signal doesn't come and go then the antenna will work great at that location. Great item from Wi-Ex.
customer_reviews.author: joe43wv

customer_reviews.title: Sad to say i couldn't get this to work
customer_reviews.text: When I bought my new house I had great Nextel service but when I switched to Sprint I only could get two bars in my house. My Verizon work phone was about the same sometimes only one bar. Outside I only got usually one more bar. I bought this unit and tried to move the antenna everywhere I could even up on the peak of my house still I couldn’t get it to give me good coverage in my house. I ended up buying an Airave for Sprint and a Verizon network extender for Verizon.
customer_reviews.author: DerekSNJ

customer_reviews.title: bOost Soho ZB545 cell phone signal  Booster
customer_reviews.text: We are having problems getting any service from our cell phones. When we first installed it we had 4 bars on o u r cell phone but the next morning we had none. We will get 1 bar from time to time but not enough to talk on to finish the call. Can you give me a number to call so we can start using this a system. It is 7 feet above the tallest part of our home and about 28 feet from unit inside. Thanks for your help.
customer_reviews.author: blg16@yahoo

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect too much
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to install. Did not boost cell signal significantly enough to make any difference.
customer_reviews.author: 1tdwelch

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Outside of our home we get 3-5 bars but inside of our small home we only get 1 bar at best near the windows. Installed the antenna on the roof suspended by a 5 foot pole. We used the included cable (did not upgrade as some people suggest). The interior unit is placed inside a closet in the middle of our small home. Now we get 3-5 bars inside the house. I can see how if you have very poor signal outside this product will no help you. The product works very well for us in our single level small home.
customer_reviews.author: nbvttd34

customer_reviews.title: Not a 'booster'  -- just a signal capture device
customer_reviews.text: Even with the outdoor yagi antenna from Wireless Extenders, the signal harvested from the Signal Booster is not very strong. OK -- I understand that the booster cannot 'boost' weak signals -- it actually is just a signal capture device. However, what is most troublesome is that the distribution of the captured signal, uh 'boosted' signal, inside the home is itself very weak. When you are in the room with the Signal Booster -- reception is OK. Move over a couple of rooms and not so much. This is supposed to support 1,500 sq ft. But, my daughter's modest 950 sq ft. ranch seems to be too much for this mighty 'booster' gizmo...
customer_reviews.author: Donald H. Dornbush

customer_reviews.title: Limited cell reception area
customer_reviews.text: Package and shipping top notch. Instruction clear and a good improvement on the cell reception in certain areas of the house. Placement of the unit is everything, Had to use the antenna outdoors to improve the signal inside and that is where the loss of the last rating star comes in. Penetrating the exterior walls of the house could only be done in one location and that limited where the booster could be placed hence only certain areas of the house improved.
customer_reviews.author: plumber

customer_reviews.title: BAD PRICE vs FUNCTION
customer_reviews.text: It does not function the way it states. It hardly boosted the signal and the amount of work to get it on the roof of the house, it wasn't worth the effort. DO NOT BUY, BAD PRICE vs FUNCTION.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B.

customer_reviews.title: New and Improved
customer_reviews.text: I cannot be without a booster. The one that I installed 9 years ago died and this is a close, direct replacement, only improved. I use the same antenna, so it was plug and play in the basement and no time in the attic. The new system has a stronger signal than the first generation unit.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Totally useless. - I have ATT and it constantly drops ...
customer_reviews.text: Totally useless. - I have ATT and it constantly drops calls. We are out in the country obviously and I followed all of the supplied directions and no luck. If you do get to make a call, you cannot walk into a different room or it will drop. Should have returned it when I had the chance but I tried multiple locations. Nothing worked. Don't waste your money... Not happy $200 into the wind.
customer_reviews.author: M Hay

customer_reviews.title: Keep these in mind and you are in good shape. Well done Zboost
customer_reviews.text: If you read the directions then it works well. 2 things to keep in mind; You need to keep the antenna 15 feet "VERTICAL" difference between the outside and inside. You will only get the reception that you normally would from the outdoor antenna location. Keep these in mind and you are in good shape. Well done Zboost.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Caspar

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job with sprint and at&t
customer_reviews.text: Had a different version that was good for sprint only. Went bad after 4 years so upgrade to a dual band which I would highly recommend. The simplicity is much easier. Green or red light shows function good or bad. Without the booster in the house is 1 or 2 bars, with the booster 4 to 5 bars. Using a 10 foot antenna above the house. Also did not like the omni antenna that came with it, purchased a yagi directional antenna and performance was much better.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I'd hoped but MUCH better than I had.
customer_reviews.text: In my tiny apartment, I was lucky to get one bar on my phone. Calls were dropped constantly, IF they even got through. With this unit, my signal strength varies from 2 to 3 bars & calls do not drop. I occasionally miss calls still if my phone is at the other end of the apartment, but it's still a big improvement. The antenna cable is over 30', so they certainly give you as much lead to put the antenna in a useful spot outside, and set up was mindlessly simple.
customer_reviews.author: Lars Elling Lunde

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: At 1st I thought this was a good product but after a week I am returning this because it's not as good as I thought. I tried putting this in 3 or 4 different places in the house and it would seem like it was fine and then later it would not give me a good signal. The last straw as when I picked up my phone and it had no signal and I am less than 10 feet from the booster. I unplugged the booster and plugged it back in and then I am getting good signal again. I give up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Kozicki

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Never had great cell reception in my house. Researched several products and decided to try this one. Works as advertised for me. I mounted the antenna on roof and used a 6 foot pole to get good height from indoor unit. Ran supplied cable down through interior wall and mounted indoor unit 2 ft off the floor on wall in hallway. Now I can get 4 bars of 3g through the whole house (1600sqft). Mobile hotspot works like a charm!! I'm connected through it as I write this review. Goodbye $80 a month crappy satellite internet!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Me, only Me

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all.  I carefully researched compatibility before purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all. I carefully researched compatibility with my phone (frequency, etc.) I missed the return window and now I am stuck with this piece of garbage. Very unhappy. I am going to post negative reviews on any site I can find.
customer_reviews.author: roborob

customer_reviews.title: It worked
customer_reviews.text: If you live where you have weak signal try this !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worked great for about 9 months then boom
customer_reviews.text: worked great for about 9 months then boom. No go. Completely dead. I have it plugged into a surge protecter and nothing else on that surge protector was damaged. That's a lot of money for something that worked great until it didn't work. I don't know if mine was a bad lemon or what. I'll try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works on duel band and 3G
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this phone booster. Works great for me I have 5. Bars where I had none. Could have larger range but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: David D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: zBoost did the job.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this myself and was surprised how easy it went. This went in our shop to support our cell phones and our wireless credit card machine. No more running outside to place a call or handle a charge. This product does what it tells you it will do. There is enough cable with it to install too. Nothing extra was needed for this set up. Supported verizon and ATT. Big thumbs up for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cathie Miller

customer_reviews.title: Does the job without wi-fi
customer_reviews.text: For my purposes, this is a good selection/solution. Inside my office I got no cell phone signal, but outside by front window, I have decent reception so I put antenna portion in window and booster in middle of office and most of the time, we get good cell reception (2 - 3 bars). This booster works independently of wi-fi and if necessary, I can add a rooftop antenna to the booster.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Nice simple unit . does what it says it will do...
customer_reviews.text: This and wifi hot spot on our phones gave us reliable cell service and Internet way out in the country. I bought a better yagi antenna for the out side antenna. Made a big difference. I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: onecleverdude

customer_reviews.title: Helped us get service on the beach
customer_reviews.text: We typically needed to go out side to use our cell phones. We installed this unit in our central bedroom because we already had co-ax installed in the room and were not using it for TV. We also used 50 feet to the antenna where I was getting 3 bars. At first it did not work well but when I changed the 50 feet to a 6 foot length to where the Coax connection to the room was located we now are getting 3 bars or better in most of the house. Nice product and did what it was supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Amazed at the difference this makes in my basement!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the ZB545 SOHO for almost 4 years in my basement and I am very impressed by the improvement for Cell phones. I have Verizon and a lot of my friends are on AT&T and it helps both tremendously. People are always amazed when I unplug it and show the difference it makes. It usually adds 2 bars to my phone and helps with Phone calls and with data. Their customer service is amazing and very helpful. A very rare thing for me to find these days. 5 stars for the product and 5 stars for the company! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Use it in an RV on our hunting lease and it brings the signal in good. I was having issues with it at first ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Use it in an RV on our hunting lease and it brings the signal in good. I was having issues with it at first with my Iphone, but I use a Mophie battery pack and once I took that off it worked fine. My two buddies, another Iphone and a Samsung had no issues and theirs worked fine. Took us from no signal inside to 3 bars which is what was found outside.
customer_reviews.author: BSwad

customer_reviews.title: WOW! cell reception
customer_reviews.text: WOW! we have cell reception w-a-y out in the country! we used to have to go outside on the porch and stand 'just so' and not move an iota, in order to take or make a call on our cell phones. now we can sit almost anyplace inside our home and talk! my son & daughter-in-law, who live nearby, bought theirs first. we were all so impressed, that we had to get one for our place, too. four, not five, stars because it isn't perfect everywhere, and we did have to upgrade the coax cable to a heavier grade.
customer_reviews.author: BoCoMoMom

customer_reviews.title: Boost you cell signal
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. I like the heavier coax, it carries a better signal. Be sure you do not plug in the power until you have everything connected. Ii is not good for your signal box.
customer_reviews.author: My Western Place

customer_reviews.title: don;t get any more bars or signal then  the a $80.00 one .
customer_reviews.text: i got one f to replace a cheep one i had for $85.00 and this one don't work any betterand i paid doble the price
customer_reviews.author: george

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I was sick of hearing the employees where I work complain about 0 bars for their AT&T phones so I started looking for answers. I must admit that I was skeptical of this thing actually working but I saw a few positive reviews so I thought I would give it a shot. I followed the advice of one of the other reviews and used my own RG6 instead of the cheap crap that was included in the box. We had to run our cable about 200' so I wanted to make sure it was quality stuff. Once that was done, we plugged in the box and waalaa! 5 bars! It works great especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery W Miller

customer_reviews.title: Signal is okay
customer_reviews.text: I found this product at a local RS and paid $387.00 then on Amazon for less than half price. Without the booster our cell signal was 1-2 bars in the home and we would have multiple dropped calls. With the booster my BB Bold has full signal and my wife's Iphone has 3-4 bars depending where in the house she is. There are no more dropped calls.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Cell Phone Booster
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought the zBoost to solve the issue of not having Sprint cell service in my house. I gave this device a full testing to see how well it would work and it did not. I did not see any results of any kind. I had the antenna placed in an area I had cell service and it made no difference. This unit did nothing for me. Maybe it works better with Verizon or a GSM carrier but for sure does not work with Sprint.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Excellent system!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent system!!! Easy set up!! I went from no service in my home with tin roof and 2,000 planted trees around me to 5 bars!! No dropped calls or delayed text. Have a 2 story home and able to use in my whole house. VERY SATISFIED!! Received 3 days after ordering!!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Hamm

customer_reviews.title: I recommended this product to a friend and now he has ...
customer_reviews.text: At first it worked quite well. The unit only lasted a year and now we are stuck. I recommended this product to a friend and now he has a dead unit as well. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works ok but if you have sprint...
customer_reviews.text: The product does seem to increase the available signal(s) from nearby towers but i have sprint and my nearby tower has a strong Verizon signal. so it boosted the Verizon signal but not the sprint signal ( I still have to go to my attic or out on my lawn to not drop a call. Called sprint. they said get an airave. I did. and it works better for me. I still think this product is good but have heard from some that you should get a better antenna cable. prob a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: cardton

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work at all.
customer_reviews.text: This didn’t boost help with the cell phone at all. It was terrible
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I use this extender in my home to get coverage in my basement. Before the unit I was getting 0-2 bars on my Iphone. After setting up the extender I now get 3-5 bars. Yea! Great price and seller. Will use this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for people with limited cell service inside their homes.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Parents who live on a farm. To use their cell phone (AT&T) they would either need to be outside or lean against a window in the corner of their house. We installed the antenna at the highest point we could reach on their roof. We used the cable that was provided, drilled a hole in the wall and pushed it through into a closet near the center of the home. Once we powered the unit, cell service was immediately available on everyone's cell phones, Very easy to install and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Chaos Momma

customer_reviews.title: For the money, works as promised..
customer_reviews.text: We own a large (metal siding/roof) 40 horse boarding stable and had no service within the barn for any of the carriers in our area (VW,TMobile,CinBell,Sprint).. I received the zBoost on time and packaged as advertised, followed all the directions and now have full coverage within the barn, approximately 3500 sq feet.. No issues, no re-arranging the antennae outside.. installed it and it's done... well worth the money if you need to extend service in a large, fairly open building like a warehouse, barn, etc...
customer_reviews.author: JTee

customer_reviews.title: 3000' coverage is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Even after the company sent me 50' RG6 it did not change the coverage area. I have 4/5 bars at the antenna location ( The location meets and exceeds zBoost requirements ) any distance form the base over 5' to 8' direct line of sight your back to what ever you had prior to installation of z Boost. 10' let alone 3000Sq foot coverage is a joke. The only reason I gave it two stars is because if you stand beside the base you will get some use out of it
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Makes a big difference
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I live in an old one-story house with very thick walls that have made it almost impossible to get cell phone reception inside. After reading the instructions, it took about 10 minutes to install this very effective gizmo (Note: we were very careful about measuring the distance between the antenna and the receiver). Our cell phones now work beautifully inside the house. What a relief!
customer_reviews.author: Coconut Grove Girl

customer_reviews.title: Boosted my cell & internet
customer_reviews.text: I lived in the mountains with no cell and internet coverage...this boosted and both signals were at their peak performance.
customer_reviews.author: Reina

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: This device did not do what I had hoped, which was to amplify a weak signal from the outside. It simply brought the weak signal from the outside, inside, just as weak. I live in a wooded area about 12 miles from the closest tower, which is probably why my cell and Internet signals are weak, but from the product description, I had really hoped that it would enhance the signal I already had. Sadly, this was not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Works but has some inherent limits
customer_reviews.text: The 50 foot coax cable is not long enough. I mount the receiving antenna in the attic up high and it seems to get the signal. However my rambler home "L" shaped and the 50 cable was not able for me to put the SOHO at the apex to serve both parts of the house. I extended the cable by about 50% and that did the job. I think the mfgr. should have included a longer cable.
customer_reviews.author: pedal2go

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS LIKE IT'S SUPPOSED TO....
customer_reviews.text: I live in the Virgin Islands and my condo is solid concrete and no signal even comes close to getting in....sometimes I have to get in my car and drive til I find a place with reception...the boosters are not available in stores here so I came to Amazon as usual...the first time my phone rang at home it was wonderful and a little bit of a surprise. What a wonderful product and it works like a dream...easy to set up even for me...won't live without a signal again...
customer_reviews.author: Joy Disney

customer_reviews.title: Cell phone works
customer_reviews.text: We moved into a new house and we must be in a dead spot. You could not make or take a phone call or text message at all. I purchased this and installed it put it in one of the guest rooms we use as an office/computer room. We put it on top of our armoire type computer desk. It immediately made a big difference by 1 or two bars but then we replaced the cable with a full size cable and ended up with 3 bars of service. Well worth it to me since I had none.
customer_reviews.author: wadeo

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Crapola
customer_reviews.text: Total Piece of Crap! The first one that came in was DOA. I ordered a replacement thinking anyone can make a Lemon. The second one came in and worked but didn't boost signal. By worked I mean it accepted my electricity :). I install a lot of cell boosters from Cellular Solutions. They are pricey but WORK! A lot of my customers complain about price. You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: David Crosby

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed - could be my fault.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to boost the cell signals in the office. The office is less that 1000 sq ft but we have not seen any improvement. We've separated the booster from the antennae, etc., to no avail. I was disappointed as this had a high rating. Maybe it is "user error" and I'm doing something wrong. I wish I could find instructions to make it work better!
customer_reviews.author: JCW

customer_reviews.title: piece of garbage was broken straight out of the box
customer_reviews.text: piece of garbage was broken straight out of the box, LED light wouldnt even flash or light up what so ever, and to top it off the seal on the side that says warranty void if seal is broken was already broken so my warranty is no good. complete junk very unhappy and a complete waste of 200$
customer_reviews.author: jesse trueblood

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this to my worst enemy
customer_reviews.text: 5 months & it simply quit working. Zboost refuses to respond to emails. I would not recommend this to my worst enemy.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Brown

customer_reviews.title: USELESS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and had such high hopes. Did not work one bit. We live Florida a few minutes from the beach, not in the middle of no where, and we have numerous towers around us and still did not work. Even standing in the same room with this device, calls still dropped and texts did not go through!!! Needed this to work so badly for work. EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rose S

customer_reviews.title: It's no substitute for having a reliable signal
customer_reviews.text: My calls were getting dropped frequently and my signal was very weak (~110 dbm), so I hoped that an amplifier would improve my reliability. I certainly have a stronger signal at the telephone with the amplifier, but when the input to the amplifier drops there's no way it can manufacture a connection out of noise, so my calls still drop about once every 30 minutes. This unit is not a substitute for having a reliable signal.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat of a pain to install the wires that hook up to it and the antenna. Specific distances must be followed for it to work properly, but it does boost my signal from one or two bars to 3 or 4 sometimes even 5. Before I would have to take my laptop to my daughter's house to get anything done online that didn't take half the day. Now I can go online and see what I want, when I want and it doesn't take long at all.
customer_reviews.author: suzyq

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have for metal buildings and poor service indoor areas.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put in my metal pole building as you have no service inside and must run outside where the signal is 3-4 out of 5 bars to answer or place a call. I now have 4-5 bars of 4G service inside my buidling all the time. The antenna was placed on top of a pvc pipe at the peak for optimium signal and it sure works. Data speeds are triple on downloads to my iphone too.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Added this to boost our signal in a single story house. Mounted antenae in the attic. Took a little testing to postion things to get the best signal. Went from little or no signal to 3-5 bars all the time. No more breaking up voices, missed calls or dropped calls . Pay attention to the the horizontal and vertical distances at installation. It really does make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Teegolf

customer_reviews.title: zBoost YX545
customer_reviews.text: The zBoost YX545 did not work in my home. Followed instructions and used RG-6 cable. Mounted on the roof of my 2 story house and was getting a signal of -95db. Maintianed 15 feeet of vertical seperation even increased to 25 but could not get any improved signal. Contacted company but they couold ony suggest a directonl antenna with a 1/4 mile reach. Had to return but received full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Steve F.

customer_reviews.title: Works as described. You have to have a signal ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. You have to have a signal outside in order for it to boost in the house. Everyday to every other day I have to rerest or unplug unit to get my green light back on. Otherwise it will stay amber and my bars drops drop to before. Weather plays a huge role in the signal also.
customer_reviews.author: Lockmaster

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction, expensive price, lousy return policy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get cell phone service at the house. From our 2nd story, on top of the outside antenna I can get one bar of cell service. I work on the road and installed this on a two week home vacation. I left and it was working. Two weeks later I got a call from home...it quit. No power in the unit. I wasn't able to get home again for 3 months, I looked at it, it's broken. The refund policy allows returns for one month from the purchase date. I'm screwed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ordering second one
customer_reviews.text: We've had one for over a year. no dropped calls since. we bought extra antenna and installed at our cabin. got tired of packing the unit back and forth so ordered another. doesn't provide 2500 sf of coverage but does boost well within about 15 ft of unit. allowed us to drop land line at cabin. I now can make long conference calls from home without dropping calls or garbled. saves on long distance.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a while
customer_reviews.text: This product works as advertised. Got three more bars than I had before. The only problem I've had is you have to constantly reboot it. It stops working several times a day. I sent the original one I bought from Amazon back and they repaired or replaced it. Worked fine for a while, now back to the same old routine. I live in a rural area, and I love this device when it works, but I guess I'll have to get something else. I hear Wilson are the best.
customer_reviews.author: E J HAMILTON

customer_reviews.title: It works just great in my remote location
customer_reviews.text: I live in a rural area and in a very hilly, metal-bearing area. My nearest cell tower is about three miles away, but because of where my home is located, the signal is not great. We set up the signal booster according to the instructions and it worked very well. It is not huge, but it Is doing a huge job. Now my phone works no matter where I am in my home. It is terrific!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Long

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: installed this product and didn't work. Called customer service and they sent me new cable and a larger antenna, but nothing worked. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: gardner al

customer_reviews.title: Works very well in our rural setting
customer_reviews.text: We have had a terrible time with cell phone service in our rural area, around a recreational lake. We have a cabin that is a manufactured home, (meaning metal!) and we had to go out in the street to get any service at all. Rain, wind, neighbors nearby are all a part of our phone conversations! Having this extender has allowed us to talk on the phone in our living room! What a wonderful thing when you have never had it before! The extender was easy to install too.
customer_reviews.author: L. Willett

customer_reviews.title: I have the clearest signal and the best quality on my cellphone calls
customer_reviews.text: I though that I will never have cellphone signal in my house until I bought Zboost. Now, I have the clearest signal and the best quality on my cellphone calls. It raised from 0 to 4-5 lines. I'm very pleased with my purchase. It really worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Diego L.

customer_reviews.title: GOOD
customer_reviews.text: IF YOU LIVE 20 MILES FROM ANYTHING LIKE ME AND HAVE PROBLEMS WITH "CALLS", DOESN'T HELP DATA, THIS IS PERFECT FOR BEING ABLE TO GET A SIGNAL INSIDE WHEN YOUR OUT OF RANGE. JUST PUT ON ROOF AND GO.
customer_reviews.author: joshua d shaw

product_meta.title: zBoost ZB545 SOHO Dual Band Cell Phone Signal Booster for Home and Office, up to 2,500 sq. ft.,White
product_meta.description:
The zBoost SOHO ZB545 boosts cell phone signals for voice and text for all major carriers. zBoost SOHO captures the reliable cellular signal you have outdoors and rebroadcasts it indoors, up to 2,500 square feet, so you can enjoy clearer, faster and more reliable service without interruption.


Everything you need is included: amplifier base unit, indoor antenna, power supply, 50 ft. of RG-6 cable, external antenna, and mounting hardware.

Benefits Include:



 * High performing dual band signal booster - coverage up to 2,500 sq. ft. (up to 64 dB system gain)
 * Ideal for small homes that have reliable outside signal
 * Reduces dropped and missed calls and provides faster 3G data performance for multiple simultaneous users
 * Boosts performance on iPhone, Samsung, Android and other phones and mobile devices
 * Automatically operates at maximum gain – no manual adjustments needed
 * Extends phone battery life - phone uses less power when the indoor signal is stronger
 * Easy to set up - all hardware included
 * Designed in Silicon Valley – Made in North America
feature_bullets: Extends cellular coverage for single or multiple users in homes or offices--provides up to 3000 square feet of coverage
Dual-band device works with 800/1900 MHz frequencies from all major carriers--AT&T, Sprint, T-Mobile, Verizon, Alltel, Cricket, and more (not compatible with Nextel)
Omni-directional signal antenna receives signals from multiple cell towers
Antenna can be installed outdoors above the roofline or indoors in the attic or near a window.Extends phone battery life--uses less power when signal is stronger
Frequency:1850 to 1990 MHz. Operating Conditions : 40°- 105° Fahrenheit

Extends cellular coverage for single or multiple users in homes or offices--provides up to 2500 square feet of coverage. NOTE - There should be a minimum of 15 vertical feet of separation between the Base Unit and External Antenna.
Dual-band device works with 800/1900 MHz frequencies from all major carriers--AT&T, Sprint, T-Mobile, Verizon, Alltel, Cricket, and more (not compatible with Nextel)
Omni-directional signal antenna receives signals from multiple cell towers
Antenna can be installed outdoors above the roofline or indoors in the attic or near a window
Antenna can be installed outdoors above the roofline or indoors in the attic or near a window
Ideal for small homes that have reliable outside signal
Reduces dropped and missed calls and provides faster 3G data performance for multiple simultaneous users
Automatically operates at maximum gain – no manual adjustments needed
